contexts.context: ...of the stalls were empty. It wouldn't be until that <mark>afternoon</mark> when his servants returned from the feast of St Rilms in...
...except the usual creaks and groans of his old house. <mark>Afternoon</mark> sunlight came through his bedroom window in ribbons, catching dust...
...and he opened his eyes. Only a little of the <mark>afternoon</mark> sunlight could pierce the inside of the burlap sack.
